medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 8 days earlier when he developed severe pleuritic chest pain, worse on the right side, and a maculopapular rash that spread from the torso to the scalp, arms, and legs. He experienced chills, diaphoresis, a throbbing frontal headache, sore throat, swollen cervical lymph nodes, a productive cough with thick yellow sputum, and diffuse myalgias and arthralgias. Symptoms persisted and worsened over the following days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of syphilis at age 18 and lumbar disk disease with L5 disk herniation. He was receiving disability payments. Previous serologic tests for syphilis and HIV were reportedly negative 6 months prior to presentation.
medical_history.family_history: Family members had a history of coronary artery disease, hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and polysubstance abuse; a sibling had died from cirrhosis related to alcohol and hepatitis C virus.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lived with a male partner with whom he had been monogamous for the past 3 years. His partner had received an HIV diagnosis 4 years prior and did not take antiretroviral medications. The patient smoked cigarettes and marijuana for many years, drank alcohol rarely after a history of heavy use, did not use intravenous drugs, and had exposure to paint chips 2 weeks prior to the illness. He owned cats and had not traveled recently.
